wikipedia_page.main:
Anne MacLeod (born 1951) is a Scottish writer.
She was born in Aberfeldy and grew up in Inverness. MacLeod studied medicine at the University of Aberdeen and works as a dermatologist. She is the mother of four children. MacLeod lives on the Black Isle.She has published two collections of poetry:

Standing by Thistles (1997)
Just the Caravaggio (1999)both of which were well-received by critics. She has also published two novels The Dark Ship (2001) and The Blue Moon Book (2004).

response: Anne MacLeod, the writer, lives on the Black Isle.
